-D|--default.#desc: reset all options to their default values

-K|--global-apropos.#desc: search for text in all pages

-l|--local-file.#desc: interpret PAGE argument(s) as local filename(s)

-w|--where|--path|--location.#desc: print physical location of man page(s)

-W|--where-cat|--location-cat.#desc: print physical location of cat file(s)

-c|--catman.#desc: used by catman to reformat out of date cat pages

-R|--recode.#desc: output source page encoded in ENCODING

-L|--locale.#desc: define the locale for this particular man search

-m|--systems.#desc: use manual pages from other systems

-M|--manpath.#desc: set search path for manual pages to PATH

-e|--extension.#desc: limit search to extension type EXTENSION

--names-only.#desc: make --regex and --wildcard match page names only,not descriptions

-P|--pager.#desc: use program PAGER to display output

-r|--prompt.#desc: provide the \'less\' pager with a prompt

-7|--ascii.#desc: display ASCII translation of certain latin1 chars

-p|--preprocessor.#desc: STRING indicates which preprocessors to run:e - [n]eqn, p - pic, t - tbl,g - grap|r - refer|v - vgrind

-H|--html.#desc: use www-browser or BROWSER to display HTML output

-X|--gxditview.#desc: use groff and display through gxditview(X11):-X = -TX75, -X100 = -TX100, -X100-12 = -TX100-12

-Z|--ditroff.#desc: use groff and force it to produce ditroff
